meanings.definition: A type of fishing trap consisting of a net supported by hoops or frames.
meanings.sent1: The fyke was set in the river to catch fish.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen use a fyke to catch fish in the lake.
meanings.sent3: The clever fyke tricked the fish into swimming into its net.
meanings.sent4: The fyke was like a spider's web, capturing unsuspecting fish.
meanings.sent5: The fyke stood silently in the water, waiting for its prey.

meanings.definition: To catch fish using a fyke.
meanings.sent1: They fyke the river every morning to gather fresh fish.
meanings.sent2: She fykes with skill, always bringing back a good catch.
meanings.sent3: He fyked so well that even the fish applauded his technique.
meanings.sent4: Fyking the lake, she felt like a master of the waters.
meanings.sent5: Fyking requires patience and precision to be successful.

meanings.definition: A device used to guide fish into a trap or net.
meanings.sent1: The fyke helped direct the fish towards the waiting net.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen relied on the fyke to lead the fish into the trap.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous fish outsmarted the fyke and swam away.
meanings.sent4: The fyke acted like a friendly guide, showing the fish the way.
meanings.sent5: The shiny fyke shimmered in the water, attracting curious fish.
